NEW YORK, NY -- Global independent music publisher Kobalt Music Group (Kobalt) has concluded a deal with multi-million selling superstar Kid Rock to administrate the worldwide publishing rights of his No. 1 album, Rock N Roll Jesus (Top Dog/Atlantic), it was announced today by Willard Ahdritz, CEO and Founder of Kobalt.

As part of the deal Kobalt will provide synchronization and licensing services for film, TV, advertising, games and other media. 

In making the announcement, Ahdritz said: "We are thrilled to have formed this new relationship with Kid Rock and Vector Management. He's a tremendous talent and we look forward to a long, fruitful relationship."

Kid Rock wrote or co-wrote 11 of 12 songs on the album, which has topped charts worldwide. His recent smash, "All Summer Long," has reached Top 10 at radio, across the board at Top 40, Hot AC, Rock and Country formats. The album Rock N Roll Jesus debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Top 200 Albums chart, and after 50 weeks has again spent the past 11 weeks in the Top 10 of the chart.

Executives involved in the deal include: Ahdritz, Michael Petersen and Bob Bortnick from Kobalt, Ken Levitan from Vector Management, and Ken Krauss, legal representative for Kid Rock.

Kid Rock is currently on a U.S. and European tour through the end of 2008.
